content.rendered:
July 2023

Message

cover story

UPDATES

in focus 1

in focus 2

in focus 3

civic driven change

partnerships

in the news

Smile Foundation receives India Today RPG Happiness Award

Smile Foundation has been recognized as the development organisation that brought the most happiness by the India Today RPG Happiness Awards. The award was presented to Mr. Santanu Mishra, Co-Founder & Executive Trustee by Mr. Harsh Goenka, Chairman, RPG industries and Mr. Arun Puri, Founder and Editor-in-chief, India Today Group. The winners were selected by the Jury, post survey and analysis by the leading research ﬁrm Marketing & Development Research Associates.

Smile kids’ ﬁrst in-ﬂight experience with Vistara

Team Vistara celebrated the 90th anniversary of JRD Tata's maiden ﬂight by sharing their world with our children and helping them experience the 'new feeling' aboard the Delhi-Amritsar-Delhi ﬂight followed by a visit to the Taj Swarna in Amritsar. The children were excited about their ﬁrst-time ﬂight experience and had a great time as they made memories for life.

Deutsche Bank employees conduct health session for kids

Employees from Deutsche Bank volunteered to conduct a health and hygiene session for children in Jaipur, Rajasthan. In partnership with Deutsche Bank, Smile Foundation is operating 7 Smile on Wheels mobile hospital projects, providing free doorstep healthcare to children and families from low-income communities in Bengaluru, Jaipur, Mumbai and Pune. Over the last seven years, the joint initiative has impacted more than 600,000 people.

Celebrating 10 Years of Siemens Scholarship Programme

The Siemens Scholarship Programme, co-implemented by Smile Foundation, completed 10 years. Since 2013, over 1335 deserving students from 120 colleges across India have received the scholarship to pursue engineering. Most of them have been placed in leading companies in sectors such as engineering, banking and ﬁnance, IT services, infrastructure, automotive and consumer goods, and in Siemens, becoming role models in their communities.

Running for Smile@Mumbai Marathon 2023

One of the largest participatory sport cum fund-raising platforms for civil society organisations in the country, the Tata Mumbai Marathon was a great success like every year. Volunteers from M&G, LIC and DDB Mudra participated and ran along with the Smile Team as the respective corporate supported Smile Foundation’s #ShikshaNaRuke campaign to help continue the education of underserved children across the country.

CNH Industrial employees volunteer to spread smiles

Team CNH Industrial invited children from Smile Foundation to their ofﬁce premises for a fun-ﬁlled day. They spent time interacting with the children, hearing their stories, and sharing their own experience in turn with the children. The CNH Team also took the kids for a tour of their ofﬁce, encouraging them to ask questions, and patiently answering every query.
